column4: lets say when i type 'ls' and i get a list of files in my directory, i have lots of files that are very very long, and i'd like to manipulate their names, is there a way i can put a switch or something on the ls command to put a number to the file list so i could then type mv 'x' where x=some number?
you want to rename files by appending them sequence number?
- yea ( i think)  ---> ls -sequence  yields file1=1 file2=2 etc... so then i could type mv (sequence#1) /home/user/short.file.name
